intro: Hieracium myrdalense, commonly known as the Myrdalen hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Scandinavia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as rocky slopes and meadows, where it can thrive in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and bloom from late summer to early autumn. Hieracium myrdalense is often found in alpine environments and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
